name: places/ChIJXTwPJCH2wokRM6uozxxIrog
formattedAddress: 151 W 100th St, New York, NY 10025, USA
adrFormatAddress: 151 W 100th St, New York, NY 10025-5146, USA

originalText.text:
As good an experience as you're going to get filing a police report for threats of physical violence on your person. The officer on duty was very nice and gave advice on all the different types of reports I could have filed depending on certain circumstances. Though she did keep transposing my 7s for 6s.

There's a metal gate separating the vestibule from the main area. Just walk thru. There's some haphazard seating but I was grateful for it. It's not going to be a quick in and out. They have to take down a lot of information by hand. Just be sure to get the attention of the officer on duty because there is no number system.
Apparently there are people who just hang out there.... I'm not going to judge, it was pretty welcoming.

Overall, considering what your emotional state might be coming there, you will leave feeling better for the experience.

originalText.text:
They STOLE  my DOG away from me 8days before my return to my country, Italy.
When I visit them for help they told me(for several days)to go ask for him to the ASPCA centers around the city.after 7days of research they admitted they took the dog who was tied outside the" jazz on the park hostel"and they decided to give him away to a trusted friend since my dog had not name on him.
They where suppose to bring him to the closer ASPCA center where they would have  figure out the owner (since my dog had microchip) and after that they would have contact me charge me for whatever the law says and let me have my dog back(this is what the law says)
but they didn't,and abusing of their power,without even know me,they said I wasn't a reliable owner and give him away.
I ask them to have the contact of the new owner they said no,I ask them to see my dog just to make sure he was fine,but they arrogantly said to me;"forget about your dog,you'll never see him again."
Now I m visiting a psychiatrist since I got anger issues and depression after these facts and words which make me think they may have did something bad to my dog.
My dog was the only mate I had during my staying in NYC and what they did is a shame against a 20years old student who had nothing else but him.
I'm ready to spend all my money to get back my dog and make them pay  for all the pain they gave me.

originalText.text: I've been working at the 24pct.  Over 19 years. Compared to other precincts I would have to say this is a great place to work. Neighborhood is very diverse and the majority of the people who live here are very concerned about the neighborhood.  All the police officer's try to do the best they can, but are directed by some inexperienced supervisors who don't know what its like to be a street cop because they passed an exam early in their carriers. Unfortunately this job is like any other big company. The worker's are not always allowed to think for themselves. If the supervisors see them having fun or thinking for themselves,  they are usually disciplined. Not an easy job. Very stressful at times. Lets not forget police officers are only human.

originalText.text: Thank you so much! You were a lifesaver. Last Night a senior citizen he is a friend fall down from his bed, I called 911, and 4 wonderful officers 1 lady and 3 gentlemen, came to the rescue, they help my friend get up fix his bed and help him get back to his bed. They really went over. God bless, and thank you so much in behalf of my friend Eddy Diaz.
